description: Number of steps to reach a prime under "replace n by concatenation of its prime factors", or -1 if no such number.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Home Prime
mathematica: nxt[n_] := FromDigits[Flatten[IntegerDigits/@Table[#[[1]], {#[[2]]}]&/@ FactorInteger[n]]]; Table[Length[NestWhileList[nxt, n, !PrimeQ[#]&]] - 1, {n, 48}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 03 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a037273 1 = -1a037273 n = length $ takeWhile ((== 0) . a010051) $   iterate (\x -> read $ concatMap show $ a027746_row x :: Integer) n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 08 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Jeff Burch_
extensions: Starting with 49, no prime has been reached after 79 steps.
Edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 23 2010
